trans-unit.source: reference time
The reference-time defines border of the active time at each weekday.

You want to show a content-element from 12:00 to 14:00 every weekday except Saturday and sunday.

How define you it?
reference-time: 12:00
active minutes: 120
weekdays: select Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr

You can although define it from the end.
reference-time: 14:00
active minutes: -120
weekdays: select Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr
active minutes
descr durationMinutes.

You want to show a content-element from 12:00 to 14:00 every weekday except Saturday and sunday.

How define you it?
reference-time: 12:00
active minutes: 120
weekdays: select Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr

You can although define it from the end.
reference-time: 14:00
active minutes: -120
weekdays: select Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr
allowed weekdays
You have to select at least one weekday.

You want to show a content-element from 12:00 to 14:00 every weekday except Saturday and sunday.

How define you it?
reference-time: 12:00
active minutes: 120
weekdays: select Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr

You can although define it from the end.
reference-time: 14:00
active minutes: -120
weekdays: select Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr
Timezone
Define a timezone

Concert
A music-band plan an internet-concert in Berlin. The beginning is 20.00 local time. You have to define the timezone and set the toggle `useTimeZoneOfFrontend` to `fixed/active'.

backgroundimige
each morning at 9:00 your website should to change the backgroundimage to induce happy morning-feelings. The effekt should happen in every timezone wolrdwide. You set the toggle `useTimeZoneOfFrontend` to `relative/not-active'. TYPO3 ignores the definition in the field `timeZoneOfEvent` and use the timezone of the frontend.
fixed timezone
Select the timezone, which TYPO3 use for this timer.

Concert
A music-band plan an internet-concert in Berlin. The beginning is 20.00 local time. You have to define the timezone and set the toggle `useTimeZoneOfFrontend` to `fixed/active'.

backgroundimige
each morning at 9:00 your website should to change the backgroundimage to induce happy morning-feelings. The effekt should happen in every timezone wolrdwide. You set the toggle `useTimeZoneOfFrontend` to `relative/not-active'. TYPO3 ignores the definition in the field `timeZoneOfEvent` and use the timezone of the frontend.
Ultimative Startdate
No active period before this ultimate startdate.

Example
You define the ultimate start for `2020-01-01 00:00:00` and the ultimate end for `2020-12-31 25:59:59`. The timer is used for your content-element only in the year 2020. Your content-element will be hidden all the time in 2019 and in 2021 or later.
Ultimative Stopdate
No active period after this ultimate stopdate.

Example
You define the ultimate start for `2020-01-01 00:00:00` and the ultimate end for `2020-12-31 25:59:59`. The timer is used for your content-element only in the year 2020. Your content-element will be hidden all the time in 2019 and in 2021 or later.
